chargeHist.descr: Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent
Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin L Gardner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligent Handling of Burning Material, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.10(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution and 10% surcharge - State has 60 days to submit restitution amount

Restitition will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment
.

Do not possess any matches or lighters
.

Complete any counseling up to PO's discretion as to addressing the defendant's mental health issues

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

Credit for 6 days if probation is ever revoked

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

records.addlTxt: Revocation Summary
revoked- sentenced to CJ
revoked - sentenced to CJ
Per DOC zero balance

from D.O. & A.O.   re: DO & AO give permission for def to reside w/ them
Per SLH:  cc: attys & JSS

4:16 PM - Def in court w/ Atty Christopher M. Zachar.  Def in custody.  Timothy Jon Gruenke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ZACHAR: I'll just have him reject  probation and proceed to sentencing. I tried to get the papers from the DOC to no avail. CRT: he has the right to reject probation. Crt reviews options w/ def. DEF: I understand giving up my right to contest the revocation and any judicial review. No promises/threats. CRT: rejection is FVI made and will accept it. GRUENKE: We are running out of options for him. He's been on probation 3 times now and they have been revoked. ZACHAR:  DOC indicated that he was in a car accident, no crim charges, but didn't report police contact, did admit to not taking meds and was out past curfew. He was working FT. I think he can safely be in the community on EM. DEF: I stopped taking my meds. CRT: risk levels haven't been reduced. 
  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed
SENTENCE: def sentenced to 8 mos CJ - def can have EM as of 12/22 at 6 PM so JSS can look at brother for living place. Credit for  89 days to be applied to confinement portion.  Crt obligations converted to civil judgment
ejss
to Transport signed by GLD

11:32 AM -  No appearance by Def - Atty Christopher M. Zachar present.  Timothy Jon Gruenke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Zachar:he's in the Vernon Cty Jail. I hdn't made any arrangments to have him transported. I will have him reject supervision on the record and proceed to sentencing. 
HEARING:  Andrea to set
C. Zachar
extended probation 6 months to allow for successful completion of Sex Offender trmt, next discharge date 4/6/16
signed SLH - extended 6 months to 4/6/16
